content: I just noticed that the lint called disallowed_type requires an entry in the clippy.toml file called disallowed-types. Is the inconsistency (the trailing s, rather than the -/_ distinction) intentional? Seems unfortunate
I don't think that's intentional. We generally use the plural form for lint names (as per https://rust-lang.github.io/rfcs/0344-conventions-galore.html#lints).
It looks like this lint is still in the nursery group so we could easily use our lint rename mechanism to pluralize it
Thanks! Will the old name continue working?

I'm actually not sure if the lint code is still executed when the old name is used.
For sure you'll get a warning that it has been renamed to the new name.

You'll get a warning that the lint will be renamed if you used warn(clippy::old_lint_name) and IIRC it will use the new lint name.

I also noticed this a while ago. But when I noticed it, this lint was already on its way to stable, so I didn't want to rename it until someone complains. So here we are, let's rename it :sweat_smile:

As long as the clippy code uses register_renamed, it should continue taking the allow/warn/deny into effect even if you use the old name.

(I spent a while working on this a few months ago for rustdoc)
